resources.name: National Museum of Natural History of Paris
DisProt
resources.description: DisProt is a database of intrinsically disordered proteins. Disordered regions are manually curated from literature. DisProt annotations cover both structural and functional aspects of disorder detected by specific experimental methods. Annotation concepts and detection methods are encoded in the Disorder Ontology.

resources.name: Protein Ensemble (PED)
resources.description: The Protein Ensemble Database (PED) is an open access database for the deposition of structural ensembles, including intrinsically disordered proteins (IDPs). Manually curated data of structural ensembles measured with nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy, small-angle X-ray scattering, fluorescence resonance energy transfer are annotated in PED. The deposition of structural coordinates can be used for the evaluation of the ensembles, thus supporting the evolution of new modeling methods leading to much improved skills of connecting the characteristic "lack of structure" of IDPs with function. Each entry in PED corresponds to the primary experimental data and to the structural ensembles associated with these data.

resources.name: Scholia
resources.description: Scholia is a service that creates visual scholarly profiles for topic, people, organizations, species, chemicals, etc using bibliographic and other information in Wikidata.

profiles.highlight: More than 1.2M pages annotated with chemical compounds. Live statistics from https://scholia.toolforge.org/chemical/.

profiles.highlight: Aggregation site about 279 datasets. Due to the aggregation not all properties can be retrieved to comply with the Bioschemas profile.

resources.name: Bgee
resources.description: Bgee is a database for retrieval and comparison of gene expression patterns across multiple animal species. It provides an intuitive answer to the question "where is a gene expressed?" and supports research in cancer and agriculture as well as evolutionary biology.

resources.name: NanoSafety Data Interface
resources.description: The NanoSafety Data Interface provides a user-friendly access to the aggregated search index of the (sub)set of eNanoMapper database instances with toxicity studies for nanomaterials.

resources.name: DaMaLOS
resources.description: DaMaLOS is a workshop about Research data and objects management for Linked Open Science, running since 2020 and co-located with ISWC

resources.name: RDMkit
resources.description: Find the answers to your Research Data Management questions in Life Sciences.

resources.name: hPSCreg: Human Pluripotent Stem Cell Registry
resources.description: hPSCreg® is a freely accessible global registry for human pluripotent stem cell lines (hPSC lines). The registry allows searching for cell lines and for information available about these cell lines. New cell lines can be registered and information to already registered cell lines can be added.

resources.name: EBiSC: European Bank for Induced pluripotent Stem Cells
resources.description: The European Bank for induced Pluripotent Stem Cells (EBiSC) is a not-for-profit hiPSC repository which collects, banks and distributes quality-assured and ethically sourced, disease relevant, research-grade hiPSC lines and data to academic and commercial researchers worldwide.

resources.name: PSnpBind
resources.description: A database of mutated binding site protein-ligand complexes constructed using a multithreaded virtual screening workflow.

profiles.highlight: Bioschemas annotation of 26 protein structures. For these 0.6 million docking results are found in the database

resources.name: eNanoMapper Tutorials
resources.description: Various tutorials developed by or during the EC FP7 project eNanoMapper about ontology development, regression modelling, and pathway analysis.

profiles.highlight: Collection of 7 tutorials indexed by ELIXIR TeSS.

resources.name: Biomedical semantics, information retrieval and knowledge discovery
resources.description: Lecture on biomedical semantics, information retrieval and knowledge discovery

resources.name: DOME recommendations with a Galaxy tutorial as use case
resources.description: In this lesson we will introduce the subject of good practices via the DOME recommendations when sharing supervised machine learning approaches with peers

resources.name: EMBL-EBI Training Courses
resources.description: To enable EMBL to deliver world-leading training in bioinformatics and scientific service provision to the research community, empowering scientists at all career stages to make the most of biological data, and strengthening bioinformatics capacity across the globe.

resources.name: Bioinformatics.ca
resources.description: Bioinformatics.ca, home of the Canadian Bioinformatics Workshops and bioinformatics resources in Canada.

resources.name: Rhea (Unofficial)
resources.description: An unofficial version of Rhea content captured using Bioschemas. Rhea is an expert-curated knowledgebase of chemical and transport reactions of biological interest - and the standard for enzyme and transporter annotation in UniProtKB. Rhea uses the chemical dictionary ChEBI (Chemical Entities of Biological Interest) to describe reaction participants.

resources.name: Bioregistry
resources.description: An open source, community curated registry, meta-registry, and compact identifier resolver.

profiles.highlight: Over 1,500 ontologies, controlled vocabularies, and resources including their preferred prefix, name, description, homepage, mappings to other registries, and more.
